column4: hi guys... just wondering if anyone could be kind enough to help me with telnet or ssh
i can't seem to login to ubuntu machine from work
sounds like a port forwarding issue
my port forwarding is enabled on the router
what do you mean?
okay i did that, just typed in yes a few times
scrolling through it
i've never had any luck with ssh
i can telnet using one of the internal computers
but can't telnet from work
yeah i know its funny... but thats what i used back in the college days
only thing i know
ssh -vvv server
if i use my isp ip i can't login
but works fine when i use my internal ip 192.... bleh bleh
ports have been forwarded on the router
i know
never had this issue with slackware back in the days,
anyone know what i'm doing wrong?
probably firewall, anyway i can open that port on the linux box?
isn't there conf file that i can edit?
yes. i'm at home on the internal network
try ssh to a remote location, then ssh back to your home
